Dead by Daylight is a game were you could be either a Killer or a Survivor. Survivers need to fix Gens and try to Loop and Juke the Killers for hope of escaping while the Killers have to Murder each Survivor (who could've guessed). I simply got the game because of the Demogorgon which sadly is not available anymore. The game is fun once you get the hang of the gameplay which isn't to hard to master but once again this game is full of saltiness. Now this something that is to be expected but seeing that the Devs don't do shit about it is just frustrating. Though having saltiness there a Players that are actually nice and even help eachother even on different sides. But the Matchmaking makes it somewhat hard. As a freshly new Killer you will and without any choice play against sweaty tryhards that most likely studied this game. And the Perks that you can unlock for your Characters are also to OP. Especially on the  Survivor side. As a Killer main I might've pissed of some Survivor mains but these perks for the Survivors make them cocky and it's not fun.
Amazing game. Fun whit friends too. You may need to spend some money on dlcs
Fun until the depression kicks in ;-;

great game, lots of new stuff added. could use some different modes to change it up a bit but aside from that no complaints!

Um dos jogos que mais tenho jogado recentemente, apesar de estar parando por falta de tempo e também porque depois de 2 anos é normal que acabe cansando um pouco. Porém o jogo continua bem interessante.
Sua ideia de ser um jogo assimétrico é legal e as mudanças nos poderes dos assassinos e novos conteúdos sendo adicionados ao jogo são coisas que mantém o jogo ainda em funcionamento e de maneira interessante. Contudo algumas coisas incomodam a mim e a grande parte da comunidade do jogo como muitos bugs que, apesar de serem consertados, sempre voltam e são raras as vezes em que o jogo está em pleno funcionamento. Além disso as questões de balanceamento entre os dois papeis no jogo tem gerado discussões também nas quais não vejo nenhum lado como certo. Muitas vezes parece que a empresa está se esforçando para melhorar o jogo mas outras vezes parece que faz exatamente o oposto. Apesar desses problemas esse ainda é um jogo muito divertido e interessante para pelo menos se conhecer e dar uma chance. Espero que no futuro esses problemas sejam, pelo menos parcialmente, resolvidos.

Союзницу схватил маньяк и насадил её на крюк . Я как истинный джентльмен , на корточках подкрался к крюку . Торгую собственным анусом , ценой собственного здоровья , снял эту шкуру с крюка ! После чего мы с ней по сосались , и теперь на крюку вешу я , бывшая заложница с ехидной ухмылкой уже заводит генератор .
После всех страданий , меня наконец-таки сняли с крюка , после чего маньяк убил всех тиммейтов , Я остался один . Заводил одновременно несколько генераторов  , а вместе с тем и перекаченного  ублюдка с тесаком .  Открыл люк ,  прыгнул в него и сбежал . Вечером пришёл домой и запустил игру !

Leute, Dead by Daylight ist ein Traum, der wahr wird. 
Ich kann ohne Probleme sagen, dass es mein Lieblingsspiel der letzten 5 Jahre ist, 

Jeder Horror-Fan kommt auf seine Kosten, es gibt so viele coole Killer, so viele vielseitige und diverse Survivor, jede Partie macht mir Spaß, auch wenn ich mal sehr eindeutig verliere. Es ist nicht zu gruselig, kann aber trotzdem hin und wieder super spannend sein. Am besten gefällt mir, dass das Entwicklerteam in wirklich jeden Killer und Survivor so viel Herzblut steckt, die Animationen tragen extrem viel zur Athmosphäre bei und es gibt für Anhänger jedes Horror-Genre einen Killer/Survivor, der/die die  eigenen Vorlieben bedient. 

Was ich mir noch wünschen würde, sind Buffy/Akte X-Charaktere und neue einzigartige Killermechaniken, die die Spielerfahrung noch einzigartiger werden lassen (so wie zum Beispiel die Saw-Mechanik). 

Vielen Dank für dieses Meisterwerk, Take my money and carry on the good work!

Mit Freunden macht es natürlich am meisten Spaß :)!

Es ist im Grunde ein wirklich gutes Spiel da jede einzelne Spielrunde eine Abwechslung sein kann.
Es verlangt einiges den Spielern ab egal ob man die Seite der Überlebenden oder die des Killer wählt. 
Hier gewinnt oft das taktische Denken, einige Gedankenspielchen mit dem Gegenüber und teilweise auch Geduld.

Die Vielfalt der verschiedenen Fähigkeiten der jeweiligen Überlebenden und Killer macht das Spiel so interessant da jeder diese anders anwendet und somit ein eigener Spielstil entstehen kann was einem Vorteile bringen kann. Wichtig als Überlebender ist das Teamwork und das beobachten der Situationen.

Nun zu den negativen Punkten des Spiel:
Leider gibt es oft genug Fehler im Spiel die Auswirkungen auf beiden Seiten haben könnten und meist zum Unbalacing führt und somit kann das Spiel schnell Unfair werden. Diese Fehler werden leider auch nach gefühlt einen Monat ernst in Arbeit genommen so das man eine gewisse Zeit mit diesen leben muss.
Makes me want to die, but still fun.

At the state of this game I would never recommend to buy this game no matter the circumstances now

Reason #1: Toxic Community
If you think League of Legends has the most toxic community, think again. They have the same situation like chat being 'very rude', people upset and throwing games, and so forth. But in league, you don't have to worry about the game being taken hostage, people's goal actually being to ruin your experience, and to make matters worse BHVR, the developers of this game, also showing this by blatantly ignoring this part of the community (check their twitter comments and you know what I mean).

Reason #2: They Don't fix anything
The servers are so bad to the point both survivors and killers start lagging backwards. They don't fix anything, but instead add content to the game to break it even further with new bugs from that content. Don't get me wrong they do fix things, it's just that the priority to fix it is clearly wrong since they go:
Cosmetics (pay money) > New Killers being overly buffed (money) > graphic changes > fixes

Don't believe me, there is a cosmetic bug in the game that causes forced set outfits (head, torso, legs)  to be separated into different cosmetics, they made 3 dedicated patches of the bug to attempt to stop it, meanwhile the new killer called Nemesis (Resident Evil Chapter) was causing frame drops down to 5 fps any time they use their ability, except for the killer 👏...👏...👏.

Reason #3: Queuing for matches in general
If you're not playing DBD at a specific time frame, you will be stuck in queue for 10-20 minutes average. This doesn't matter where you are at in their broken MMR system, you will always have the same queue times as anyone else. The only correct time is 3pm-8pm of your own time zone since that's when the kids are playing on their xboxes and playstations.

Reason #4: Unbalance MMR (Match Making Rating) system
The MMR system is based not upon the total points that is built into the game but rather your escapes as survivor or the number of hooks you have; the problem with this is that this doesn't actually account for skill, if a really good survivor get chased the entire game and gets killed in the end they lose MMR, if the killer stays besides the hooked person they also lose MMR. If you're wondering how I know this, I do have 1500+ hours, but I took a LONG break before the MMR started up and when I started playing (Feb 2022) I was playing against iridescent level players 24/7 (these are people who are GRINDING this game).

Reason #5: Balancing Issues
Now before you skip this I promise I won't go into detail of what should be balanced or rework; We all have heard complaints about nerfs needed here and buffs needed there, but the ENTIRE COMMUNITY have to agree on is that this game is bad at balancing control in this game. Have you heard the story of Darth Huntress...
Once upon a time when Huntress was released, one-hit and you're down hatchets add-ons on huntress was reduced to 1, but you can have an add-on to increase it to 3 hatchets. And if you have the perk Iron Maiden (increase reload of grabbing more hatchets by 50%) with Knock Out (survivors downed can't be seen until close to them) then Huntress essentially won the game. But after 5 years went by, Joe-Biden said, "SODA!" Which sparked inspiration to the idea to have it permanently be one no matter the add-ons equipped!
FIVE. FUCKING. YEARS!

Conclusion:
Don't buy it! help your friends,  whose convincing you to buy it, by telling them to uninstall Dead By Daylught and play league of legends since the community is better there.

Oof, where do I start? Let's start with the good. The game is pretty fun and you get to play with your friends and stuff and playing killer is pretty alright (sometimes but I'll get into that later). Now onto the "meh", let's start with some of the perks, most of them are gimmicks, *cough* Mad Grit *cough*, you can't even notice the difference on some of the perks, like ace's perks, he's based on luck, which literally only affects the chance of you freeing yourself from a hook, and sometimes he can make items spawn with add-ons, wow! And now the bad, the matchmaking in this game is pretty shoddy, you do good in one game as a survivor in ash rank and it pins you against late gold and early red ranks, I have lost count of how many times I have done good in one game and then I immediately got boosted up to high rank lobbies because of ONE game, this also happens in killer games! You did good against some ash ranks? Prepare to get mauled by some red and gold ranks that have over 400 hours on the game and run meta perks. Speaking of meta perks, before I get into it yes, I know that all games have some sort of a "meta" but in this game you usually have to run those perks or risk getting absolutely dumped on, the games get pretty stale when you can just predict right off the bat what killers have, every build usually has bbq. But if you can look past all of that and play the game with a few friends I would say it's worth the buy.
